summary: In 2025, the Department of the Interior's Indian Affairs froze hiring and offered voluntary resignation and early retirement to its employees in response to presidential directives. Its total workforce, which numbered 7,470 in January, had decreased by 11% by the end of July. Agency officials said the reductions resulted in the loss of experienced leadership and placed additional strain on already short-staffed offices. Tribal leaders...
title: Indian Affairs: Information on 2025 Workforce Reductions
